p: Hempseed is a good source of lignan (320 mg/kg DM) ( 57, 58). It is dominated by lignanamides (cannabisin A) while HSC and inflorescences are dominated by flavanols (i.e., catechin; Table 4). More so, 99% of lignans are found in hempseed hulls, hence, dehulled hempseeds and the resultant cake have little lignan ( 57, 59). Syringaresinol content of hempseed hull (280 mg/kg DM) is the highest of any dietary source ( 57). Since HSC is produced from hulled seeds, its lignan content is expected to be low. However, there is limited literature on the lignan contents of HSC and leaves.
